p: ZIKV infection is asymptomatic in an estimated 80% of cases [ 10, 11, 12]. When symptomatic, ZIKV infection usually presents with non-specific influenza-like symptoms, including rash, fever, arthralgia, myalgia, headache, and conjunctivitis, typically lasting 3â€“6 days [ 10, 12]. Infections may be clinically difficult to distinguish from diseases caused by other arboviruses including Dengue virus (DENV), Chikungunya, and West Nile virus [ 9].
